multimonster.common.pipe
Class Channel

java.lang.Object
  multimonster.common.pipe.Channel
Direct Known Subclasses:
BufferedChannel
public abstract class Channel
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a Channel for a Pipe to transfer data.

Author:
Jörg Meier

isClosed

Checks if the channel is closed.

Returns:

close

public abstract void close()
Closes the channel.

read

public abstract byte[] read(int length)
                     throws ChannelClosedException
Parameters:
length - - the number of bytes to read Read Data out of the channel. read() blocks when there is no more data in the channel and continues when there is data again to transfer. returns a new byte[] with the length of read bytes
Throws:
ChannelClosedException

write

public abstract void write(byte[] in,
                           int len)
                    throws ChannelClosedException
Writes data in the channel to transfer it. Blocks when the channel is full and continues when there is space again.

Parameters:
in - the data
len - the amount to write to the channel
Throws:
ChannelClosedException

write

public abstract void write(byte[] in)
                    throws ChannelClosedException
Writes data in the channel to transfer it. Blocks when the channel is full and continues when there is space again.

Parameters:
in - the bytes to write in the channel
Throws:
ChannelClosedException
